statements: CREATE TABLE CloudComputingData (id INT PRIMARY KEY, company_name VARCHAR(50), service_offered VARCHAR(100), location VARCHAR(50))
CREATE TABLE cloud_providers (provider_id INT PRIMARY KEY, provider_name VARCHAR(50), headquarters_location VARCHAR(100))
CREATE TABLE cloud_services (service_id INT PRIMARY KEY, service_name VARCHAR(50), provider_id INT, FOREIGN KEY (provider_id) REFERENCES cloud_providers(provider_id))
CREATE TABLE example_table (example_id INT PRIMARY KEY, example_name VARCHAR(50), example_location VARCHAR(100))
CREATE TABLE cloud_providers (provider_id INT PRIMARY KEY, provider_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, location VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL);
CREATE TABLE customers (customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY, customer_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, email VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL);
CREATE TABLE products (product_id INT PRIMARY KEY, product_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, price DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL);
CREATE TABLE instance ( instance_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, provider VARCHAR(255), region VARCHAR(255), instance_type VARCHAR(255) );
CREATE TABLE storage ( storage_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, provider VARCHAR(255), region VARCHAR(255), storage_type VARCHAR(255) );
CREATE TABLE network ( network_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, provider VARCHAR(255), region VARCHAR(255), network_type VARCHAR(255) );
